definition: surging forward with great momentum/unfolding on a magnificent scale
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
Zhuang ethnic group of Guangxi, the PRC's second most numerous ethnic group

sentences.english: In the edge of the vast South China Sea, a red sun is rising.
sentences.chinese: 在波瀾壯闊的中國南海之端，一輪紅日正在冉冉升起。

sentences.english: After the Revolution of 1911, China went through the vicissitudes of revolutionary turmoils.
sentences.chinese: 辛亥革命以後，中國經歷了波瀾壯闊的革命場景。

sentences.english: Well, I hope no great billows and shock.
sentences.chinese: 那麼，希望沒有波瀾壯闊石破天驚。

definition: lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
to stand tall and see far (idiom); taking the long and broad view/acute foresight
after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life

(last line of the poem 望岳 by Tang poet Du Fu 杜甫[Du4 Fu3]) with one look I shall see all the smaller mountains down below (from the summit of Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1])/(fig.) awe-inspiring view from a very high place
